byline.contributor: Hala Droubi reported from Dubai and Julie Creswell and Nelson D. Schwartz from New York. Jad Mouawad contributed reporting from New York, and Ceylan Yeginsu and Safak Timur contributed reporting from Istanbul.
byline.original: By HALA DROUBI, JULIE CRESWELL and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

abstract: Value of Donald J Trump's brand is in question in Middle East following his call to stop Muslims from entering United States; Trump says he is ready to live with lost business; is first time his presidential campaign remarks have cost him money.
lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States has provoked outrage in the Middle East that could threaten his brand’s golden appeal there.

headline.main: Donald Trump Loses Luster When Words Reach the Middle East

snippet: Donald J. Trump’s plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States has provoked outrage in the Middle East that could threaten his brand’s golden appeal there.
